title: Au'a 'Ia
notes: (translation from Ka 'Aha Hula 'O Hālauaoloa program booklet)

Hawaiian: 'O ke kama, kama, kama, kama i ka hulinu'u
'O ke kama, kama, kama, kama i ka huliau
Hulihia pāpio a i lalo i ke ola
'O ka hana 'ana i hiki o Hulahula
Nāna i hala pepe ka honua o ka moku
I hā'ale 'ia i ke Kiuwelo i ka pu'u
English: Kama refused to part with his island
This is the land held back by Kama
The son Kama, the highest born
The son Kama, who is the turning point of the changing times
He turns his foes face down
He turns them to the imu
and the Maki'ilohelohe ceremony is complete
He does this until the Hulahula ceremony is complete
The edge of the upright stone is rolled into place
With his nets known as Ihuaniani
Of Keawe who broke the kapu and ruled in sanctity
He who ruled and made the island subject to him
Stirred by the Kiuwelo wind in the summit

Hawaiian: E ala e, ka lā i ka hikina,
I ka moana, ka moana hohonu,
Pi'i ka lewa, ka lewa nu'u,
I ka hikina, aia ka lā, e ala e!
English: Awaken/Arise, the sun in the east
From the ocean, the deep ocean,
Climbing to heaven, the highest heaven,
In the east, there is the sun, arise!

Hawaiian: Aloha kama kūkū kapa a ka wahine
English: Greetings to the two of us
The one star that is suspended
Greetings to the child of the kapa beating woman

Hawaiian: Nā 'aumākua mai ka lā hiki a ka lā kau
Maui ka ho'oku'i a ka hālāwai.
Nā 'aumākua iā ka hina kua, iā ka hina alo
Eia ka pulapula a 'oukou 'o Mauna A Wākea.
English: You ancestral dieties from the rising to the setting sun
From the zenith to the horizon
You ancestral dieties who stand at our back and at our front
You gods who stand at our right hand
A clear ringing voice in the heavens,
A voice reverberating in the heavens.
Here is your descendant Mauna A Wākea

Hawaiian: Onaona i ka hala me ka lehua
He hale lehua nō ia na ka noe
O ka'u nō ia e 'ano'i nei
E li'a nei ho'i o ka hiki mai
A hiki pū nō me ke aloha
English: A house of lehua for the mist
For when you / you folks / we/ come

Hawaiian: Liu liu wale i ka uka o ka Holalele
E komo, e komo aku ho'i au maloko
Ina ka pu'u nui o waho nei la e
He anu e, he anu e, he ko'e ko'e wale no
English: Cold is the uplands of Holalele
The upper and ocean areas of Papala-e
For a desire is building in me
A cold, a cold chill for the wet and cold

Hawaiian: E ulu i ka pae 'āina o Hawai'i
E hō mai ka maopopo pono,
English: May the whole archipelago of Hawai'i flourish.

title: Pu'uhonua o Kukuipuka
notes: A sacred Heiau (Hawaiian Temple) in Kahakuloa, Maui. Rediscovered and restored by ohana & Kahu Lei'ohu Ryder & Akoni Akana. It is a place of prayer, prophecy, spiritual refuge, peace & healing.

English: for the whisper of your wisdom
